info.title: LifeTime REST API
info.description: The LifeTime API allows you to manage applications, modules, environments, deployments, users, teams, roles and deployment zones of your OutSystems infrastructure. Please bear in mind that what while the LifeTime UI and API deal with the same concepts, there are scenarios that are supported only via UI. All API operations are limited to the permissions associated with the Service Account used to call it, as defined in LifeTime. For operations on DB connections, the permissions are defined at the environment level. For more information about DB connection permissions, please refer to the following link: [Allow Integrations With External Databases](https://success.outsystems.com/documentation/11/managing_outsystems_platform_and_application_lifecycle/manage_it_users/allow_integrations_with_external_databases/). For more information about authentication, follow the guidelines presented in [REST API Authentication](https://success.outsystems.com/documentation/11/reference/outsystems_apis/lifetime_api_v2/rest_api_authentication/) to authenticate your API requests. You can download the Swagger file for the LifeTime API v2 in the download page of LifeTime Management Console binaries (available from LifeTime version 11.5.0). Go to the [Downloads area](https://www.outsystems.com/Downloads/search/LifeTime/11), and select your LifeTime version The LifeTime API is available through your LifeTime environment, with the API base URL determined by your LifeTime environment's domain. For instance, if your LifeTime address is example-lt.example.com/lifetime, then the LifeTime API base URL is example-lt.example.com/lifetimeapi/rest/v2. Base URL: /lifetimeapi/rest/v2 Version: v2 Scheme: https

get.summary: Returns a list of applications that exist in the infrastructure.

parameters.name: IncludeModules
parameters.description: When set to true, the modules are also returned. The default value is false.

parameters.name: IncludeEnvStatus
parameters.description: When set to true, the application status per environment is also returned. The default value is false.

schema.description: A list of Application records including AppStatusInEnv sub-lists, if requested.

204.description: No applications available in the infrastructure.

400.description: Failed to retrieve applications because IncludeModules was requested but IncludeEnvStatus was not, or invalid request when listing all applications.

500.description: Failed to list the applications.

get.summary: Returns the details of a given application.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the desired application.

parameters.name: IncludeModules
parameters.description: When set to true, the modules details are also retrieved. The default value is false.

parameters.name: IncludeEnvStatus
parameters.description: When set to true, the application status per environment is also returned. The default value is false.

200.description: An Application record including an AppStatusInEnv sub-list, if requested.

400.description: Failed to retrieve applications because IncludeModules and IncludeEnvStatus parameters were incorrect.

403.description: Failed listing all applications because user has insufficient permissions.

404.description: Failed getting running applications because one of the environments was not found.

500.description: Failed to retrieve the application.

get.summary: Get the application configurations in each environment for the application provided.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the desired application.

200.description: List of the application configurations in each environment for the application provided.

400.description: Failed getting application configurations because the parameter was incorrect.

403.description: Failed getting application configurations because user has insufficient permissions.

404.description: Failed getting application configurations because the application was not found.

500.description: Failed getting application configurations.

put.summary: Updates the application configurations in each environment provided.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the desired application.

parameters.name: ApplicationConfigurations
parameters.description: List of configurations to be applied to the application in each environment provided.

400.description: Configurations couldn't be applied for application <ApplicationKey>.

403.description: Service Account doesn't have change & deploy permission to the application with key <ApplicationKey> in one of the environments provided.

404.description: Application with key <ApplicationKey> not found, or environment with key <EnvironmentKey> not found.

405.description: Method not allowed due to the feature being disabled in the infrastructure.

500.description: Failed to execute command <Command> for application with key <ApplicationKey>.

get.summary: Returns a list of versions of a given application.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the desired application.

parameters.name: ChangeLogFilter
parameters.description: Optional filter. If present, only versions containing this string in the change log will be returned.

parameters.name: MaximumVersionsToReturn
parameters.description: The maximum number of versions to return. The default value is 5.

schema.description: A list of ApplicationVersion records.

400.description: Invalid request due to invalid max versions to return (less than 0).

403.description: Failed to retrieve the application with key <ApplicationKey>. The user does not have the required permissions.

404.description: Failed to retrieve the application with key <ApplicationKey>.

500.description: Failed to list the application versions.

delete.summary: Discards an application version, if possible.
delete.description: Running versions, or versions used in Deployments cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the application whose version to be deleted.

parameters.name: VersionKey
parameters.description: The key of the application version to be deleted.

403.description: Service Account doesn't have permissions to delete the specified application version.

404.description: Application or application version not found.

500.description: Failed to delete application version <VersionKey>.

get.summary: Returns the details of a given version of the specified application.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the application whose version is being requested.

parameters.name: IncludeModules
parameters.description: When set to true, the modules details are also retrieved.

parameters.name: VersionKey
parameters.description: The key of the desired application version.

403.description: Failed to retrieve the application with key <ApplicationKey>. The user does not have the required permissions.

404.description: Failed to retrieve the application with key <ApplicationKey>.

500.description: Failed to retrieve the application version.

get.summary: Returns a link where the binary file for a given application version can be downloaded.
get.description: The link will expire in 60 minutes.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the application for which to get the binary file link.

parameters.name: VersionKey
parameters.description: The key of the application version for which to get the binary file link.

200.description: The link for the application binary file.

Expires.description: The expiration date and time of the returned link.

204.description: No binary available for given keys.

400.description: The request is invalid for the given keys (Application:<ApplicationKey>; ApplicationVersionKey <ApplicationVersionKey>).

403.description: User doesn’t have permissions for the given keys (Application:<ApplicationKey>; ApplicationVersionKey <ApplicationVersionKey>).

404.description: Failed to retrieve the application with key <ApplicationKey> or the application version with key <ApplicationVersionKey>.

500.description: Failed to download the oap of the application version.

post.summary: Renew the token of the user making the call.

parameters.name: Duration
parameters.description: How long the token should be renewed.

400.description: Invalid request.

403.description: Invalid user permissions.

404.description: User not found.

500.description: Invalid Operation.

post.summary: Creates a deployment to a target environment.
post.description:
An optional list of applications to include in the deployment can be specified. The input is a subset of deployment object. Application versions that are associated to blocked applications in the target environment cannot be included in the deployment.

From LifeTime 11.21.0, it is possible to create and edit multiple deployment plans for the same target environment in parallel.

parameters.name: DeploymentData
parameters.description: A Deployment record.

schema.description: The key of the newly created deployment.

400.description: Invalid request.

403.description: Invalid user permissions.

404.description: Source or target environment not found.

500.description: Failed to create deployment from environment <SourceEnvironmentKey> to environment <TargetEnvironmentKey>.

get.summary: Returns a list of deployments ordered by creation date, from newest to oldest.

parameters.name: MinDate
parameters.description: The minimum creation date of the deployments to return. The default value is 1 week before the current date.

parameters.name: MaxDate
parameters.description: The maximum creation date of the deployments to return. The default value is the current date.

parameters.name: TargetEnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the target environment to return the deployments from. If the user does not have access to the environment, the list returned will be empty. If no environment key is passed, the list will not be filtered by any target environment.

schema.description: A list of Deployment records.

204.description: There are no deployments created between <MinDate> and <MaxDate> for environment key <TargetEnvironmentKey>.

400.description: Invalid request for list of deployments created between <MinDate> and <MaxDate> for environment key <TargetEnvironmentKey>.

403.description: User doesn't have access to any environment.

500.description: Failed to list the deployments.

delete.description: Only deployments whose state is “saved” can be deleted.

parameters.name: DeploymentKey
parameters.description: The key of the deployment to delete.

400.description: Deployment with key <DeploymentKey> cannot be deleted

403.description: Service Account doesn't have permissions to the deployment with key <DeploymentKey>.

404.description: Deployment with key <DeploymentKey> not found.

500.description: Failed to delete deployment <DeploymentKey>.

put.description:
An optional list of applications to include in the deployment can be specified. The input is a subset of deployment object. Using this method to remove apps from a deployment plan sets their status as 'Do Nothing', but they still appear in the deployment details. Application versions that  are associated to blocked applications in the target environment cannot be included in the deployment. 

From LifeTime 11.21.0, it is possible to create and edit multiple deployment plans for the same target environment in parallel.
From LifeTime 11.22.0 or later, the apps are removed from the deployment plan. For more information, refer to [Breaking Changes](https://success.outsystems.com/support/release_notes/11/outsystems_11_side_effects_and_breaking_changes/#introduced-in-lifetime-11.22.0).

parameters.name: DeploymentKey
parameters.description: The key of the deployment to update.

parameters.name: DeploymentData
parameters.description: The deployment information to update.

400.description: Invalid request.

403.description: Invalid user permissions.

404.description: Deployment plan not found.

500.description: Failed to update deployment with key <DeploymentKey>.

get.summary: Returns the details of a given deployment.
get.description: The returned information contains the included applications and the possible conflicts that can arise from the deployment of the current applications. Bear in mind that while this is a GET method, calling it may update the state of the deployment plan. This is because knowing the state of a deployment plan requires the plan to have been validated, and the validation process may change the plan's state (e.g. for instance, calling this method immediately after having created a new deployment plan will change its state to either valid or invalid).

parameters.name: DeploymentKey
parameters.description: The key of the desired deployment.

403.description: User doesn't have permissions to the deployment with key <DeploymentKey>.

404.description: Deployment with key <DeploymentKey> not found.

500.description: Failed to access the details of deployment with key <DeploymentKey>.

post.summary: Executes the given command in a specified deployment.
post.description:
The allowed commands are “start”, “continue” and “abort”. These commands cannot be executed if there are applications marked as Tag & Deploy through UI in the deployment plan.
  • start:
    • is accepted only if staging has not yet been started, contains applications, no inconsistencies are found after staging validation, and the target environment is not in maintenance mode or offline.
  • continue:
    • is accepted when staging has already started and is in the transition between stage one and two, awaiting progression to step two (if two-step deployment is configured) and the target environment is not in maintenance mode or offline.
  • abort:
    • is accepted until the moment before staging begins to be deployed on the platform server of the target environment.
Starting with LifeTime 11.24.0, it is possible to execute multiple deployment plans for the same target environment in parallel.

parameters.name: DeploymentKey
parameters.description: The key of the deployment where the command will be executed.

parameters.name: Command
parameters.description: The command to execute. One of “start”, “continue” or “abort”.

parameters.name: RedeployOutdated
parameters.description: If True, outdated applications in the target environment will be redeployed.

parameters.name: IncludeErrorDetails
parameters.description: If True, when an error occurs the returned message will contain more details about the error in question.

400.description: Command <Command> can't be executed for deployment <DeploymentKey>.

403.description: Service Account doesn't have permissions to the deployment with key <DeploymentKey>.

404.description: Deployment with key <DeploymentKey> not found, or command not found.

500.description: Failed to execute command <Command> for deployment with key <DeploymentKey>.

get.summary: Returns the details of a given deployment execution, including the deployment status and messages.

parameters.name: DeploymentKey
parameters.description: The key of the deployment whose status is being requested.

403.description: User doesn't have permissions to the deployment with key <DeploymentKey>.

404.description: Deployment with key <DeploymentKey> not found.

500.description: Failed to retrieve the status of the deployment with key <DeploymentKey>.

get.summary: Returns the list of extension logical databases that need to be mapped to database connection strings in the destination environment for the deployment to proceed.

parameters.name: DeploymentKey
parameters.description: The key of the desired deployment.

200.description: A list of extensions and logical databases to be mapped.

400.description:
One of the following errors:
- The deployment provided does not exist
- The target environment does not have this capability

500.description: Message describing the error.

post.summary: Maps the database connections for the extensions' logical databases in the deployment specified.
post.description: This endpoint requires LifeTime version 11.21.1, or higher.

parameters.name: DeploymentKey
parameters.description: The key of the desired deployment.

parameters.name: DatabaseMapping
parameters.description: The mapping to database connections for all the logical databases of an extension.

400.description:
One of the following errors:
- The deployment provided is not awaiting for confirmation
- Extension mappings were not provided
- DB mappings were not provided for extension <ExtensionKey>
- The extension provided does not exist or is not part of this deployment: <ExtensionKey>
- The logical database <LogicalDatabaseName> does not exist for this extension
- The database <DatabaseName> does not exist for this extension
- The mapping for the following extension was not provided: <ExtensionKey>
- The mapping for the following logical database was not provided: <LogicalDatabase>
- The target environment does not have this capability

403.description: You don't have permissions to continue with the deployment.

404.description:
One of the following errors:
- The requested resource does not exist.
- The deployment provided does not exist

500.description: There was an internal error when continuing with the deployment.

post.summary: Register the environment in LifeTime.

parameters.name: EnvironmentRegistration
parameters.description: An environment record

400.description: Failed to register the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because there are invalid parameters in the request.

403.description: Failed to register the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because of invalid permissions.

405.description: Failed to register the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because the feature is not enabled.

500.description: Failed to register the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because of an internal error.

get.summary: Lists all the environments in the infrastructure.

schema.description: A list of Environment records.

500.description: Failed to list the environments.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: An environment key

404.description: Failed to unregister the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because it was not found.

405.description: Failed to unregister the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because the feature is not enabled.

500.description: Failed to unregister environment from LifeTime.

get.summary: Returns the details of a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the desired environment.

403.description: Failed to retrieve the environment with key: <EnvironmentKey>. The user does not have the required permissions.

404.description: Failed to retrieve the environment with key: <EnvironmentKey>.

500.description: Failed to access the details of environment.

get.summary: Returns information about the running versions of all applications in a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment whose list of running applications is being requested.

parameters.name: IncludeModules
parameters.description: When set to true, the modules details are also retrieved. The default value is false.

parameters.name: IncludeEnvStatus
parameters.description: When set to true, the applications' status information in the environment is included in the result. The default value is false.

200.description: Applications list for the given environment successfully retrieved.

schema.description: A list of Application records.

204.description: No applications found in environment with key <EnvironmentKey>.

400.description: Failed to retrieve applications published in environment because IncludeModules and IncludeEnvStatus parameters were incorrect, or Invalid request when getting running applications for environment with key <EnvironmentKey>.

403.description: Failed to retrieve the running applications for environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because user has insufficient permissions.

404.description: Failed to retrieve running applications for environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because it was not found.

post.summary: Creates a new application.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment to create the application.

parameters.name: ApplicationCreate
parameters.description: A structure holding the name, description and other attributes of the new application.

201.description: The key of the newly created application.

400.description: Failed to create the application in the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because there are invalid parameters in the request.

403.description: Failed to create the applicaton in the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because the user has insufficient permissions.

404.description: Failed to create a new application in the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because it was not found.

500.description: Failed to create the application in the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> because of an internal error.

get.summary: Returns information about the running version of the specified application in a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the running application details.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the application whose details are being requested.

parameters.name: IncludeEnvStatus
parameters.description: When set to true, the applications' status information in the environment is included in the result. The default value is false.

parameters.name: IncludeModules
parameters.description: When set to true, the modules details are also retrieved. The default value is false.

400.description: Request asked for Modules but not for Status.

403.description: User doesn't have permissions for the given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ApplicationKey:<ApplicationKey>).

404.description: Failed to retrieve the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> or the application with key <ApplicationKey>.

500.description: Failed to access the running version of an application.

get.summary: Returns a link where the binary file for a given application can be downloaded.
get.description: If the requested type of binary file is '.aab', and the application binary file type is '.apk', the download link will get a '.apk' binary file. Otherwise, it will get a '.aab' binary file.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the application binary file link.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the application for which to get the binary file link.

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: The type of binary file to return, when applicable. One of “oap”, “apk”, “aab” or “ipa”.

200.description: Binary file download link successfully retrieved.

Expires.description: The expiration date and time of the returned link.

204.description: No binary available for given type and keys.

400.description: The required type <Type> is invalid for given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ApplicationKey:<ApplicationKey>).

403.description: User doesn't have permissions for the given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ApplicationKey:<ApplicationKey>).

404.description: Failed to retrieve the environment with key <EnvironmentKey> or the application with key <ApplicationKey>.

500.description: Failed to download <Type> of an application.

post.summary: Request the creation of the source code package of the application to be downloaded.
post.description: This endpoint requires LifeTime version 11.21.1 and Platform Server 11.27.0, or higher.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the source code of the application.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the application for which to get the source code.

200.description: Operation key identifier, status and operation messages.

400.description: The required type <Type> is invalid for given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ApplicationKey:<ApplicationKey>).

403.description: User doesn't have permissions for the given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ApplicationKey:<ApplicationKey>).

404.description: No environment or application found. Please check that the EnvironmentKey and ApplicationKey exist.

500.description: Failed to start the operation to package all the source code files.

get.summary: Returns a link where the source code package can be downloaded.
get.description: The link will expire in 60 minutes. This endpoint requires LifeTime version 11.21.1 and Platform Server 11.27.0, or higher.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the source code of the application.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the application for which to get the source code.

parameters.name: PackageKey
parameters.description: The key of the application's source code operation.

200.description: The link for the application binary file.

Expires.description: The expiration date and time of the returned link.

400.description: The required type <Type> is invalid for given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ApplicationKey:<ApplicationKey>).

403.description: User doesn't have permissions for the given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ApplicationKey:<ApplicationKey>).

404.description: No environment or application found. Please check that the EnvironmentKey and ApplicationKey exist.

500.description: Failed to start the operation to package all the source code files.

get.summary: Returns the details of a given source code packaging execution, including the status and messages.
get.description: This endpoint requires LifeTime version 11.21.1 and Platform Server 11.27.0, or higher.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the source code of the application.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the application for which to get the source code.

parameters.name: PackageKey
parameters.description: The key of the application's source code operation.

200.description: Operation key identifier, status and operation messages.

400.description: The required type <Type> is invalid for given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ApplicationKey:<ApplicationKey>).

403.description: User doesn't have permissions for the given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ApplicationKey:<ApplicationKey>).

404.description: No environment or application found. Please check that the EnvironmentKey and ApplicationKey exist.

500.description: Failed to start the operation to package all the source code files.

post.summary: Creates a new version of the application based on the current running instance.
post.description: Note that the new version will require some processing time before it becomes available for use.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the application.

parameters.name: ApplicationKey
parameters.description: The key of the application for which to generate a new version.

parameters.name: ApplicationVersionCreate
parameters.description: A structure holding the new version name for the application and for its native applications, if applicable.

400.description: Invalid request.

403.description: Invalid user permissions.

404.description: Environment or application not found.

500.description: Failed to tag an application, or Failed to create a new version for application <ApplicationName>.

post.summary: Request the creation of the source code package of the module to be downloaded.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the source code of the module.

parameters.name: ModuleKey
parameters.description: The key of the module for which to get the source code.

200.description: Operation key identifier, status and operation messages.

400.description: The required type <Type> is invalid for given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ModuleKey:<ModuleKey>).

403.description: User doesn't have permissions for the given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ModuleKey:<ModuleKey>).

404.description: No environment or module found. Please check that the EnvironmentKey and ModuleKey exist.

500.description: Failed to start the operation to package all the source code files.

get.summary: Returns a link where the module's source code package can be downloaded.
get.description: The link will expire in 60 minutes.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the source code of the module.

parameters.name: ModuleKey
parameters.description: The key of the module for which to get the source code.

parameters.name: PackageKey
parameters.description: The key of the module's source code operation.

200.description: The link for the module binary file.

Expires.description: The expiration date and time of the returned link.

400.description: The required type <Type> is invalid for given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ModuleKey:<ModuleKey>).

403.description: User doesn't have permissions for the given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; Module:<ModuleKey>).

404.description: No environment or module found. Please check that the EnvironmentKey and ModuleKey exist.

500.description: Failed to start the operation to package all the source code files.

get.summary: Returns the details of a given module's source code packaging execution, including the status and messages.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the source code of the module.

parameters.name: ModuleKey
parameters.description: The key of the module for which to get the source code.

parameters.name: PackageKey
parameters.description: The key of the module's source code operation.

200.description: Operation key identifier, status and operation messages.

400.description: The required type 'Type' is invalid for given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ModuleKey:<ModuleKey>).

403.description: User doesn't have permissions for the given keys (EnvironmentKey:<EnvironmentKey>; ModuleKey:<ModuleKey>).

404.description: No environment or module found. Please check that the EnvironmentKey and ModuleKey exist.

500.description: Failed to start the operation to package all the source code files.

get.summary: Returns information about the deployment zones available in a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the running application details.

schema.description: A list of DeploymentZone records.

400.description: Failed to access the deployment zones of environment.

403.description: Failed to retrieve the deployment zones of environment <EnvironmentName> (key: <EnvironmentKey>). Error: The user does not have the required permissions, or Feature not Licensed.

404.description: Failed to retrieve the deployment zones of environment with key: <EnvironmentKey>.

500.description: Failed to access the deployment zones of environment.

put.summary: Sets the maintenance mode (true or false) of a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: Key of the Environment

parameters.name: MaintenanceModeSetting
parameters.description:
IsMaintenanceModeEnabled: value to the maintenance mode of an Environment.
 True: Changes the maintenance mode of the environment to enabled.
 False: Changes the maintenance mode of the to disabled.

Reason: The reason why the environment maintenance mode is being set to enabled or disabled.

400.description: Failed to update the maintenance mode status due to a bad request.

403.description: User doesn't have permissions.

404.description: Environment not found.

500.description: Internal error raised.

get.summary: Returns information about the templates available in a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the running application details.

schema.description: A list of Template records.

400.description: Environment doesn't support list templates.

403.description: User doesn't have permissions.

404.description: Environment not found.

500.description: Internal error raised.

get.summary: Returns information about the content security policies in a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the running content security policies.

400.description: Failed to retrieve content security policies.

403.description: User doesn't have permissions.

404.description: Environment not found.

500.description: Internal error raised.

put.summary: Sets the Content Security Policies for a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment from which to get the running content security policies.

400.description: Failed to retrieve content security policies.

403.description: User doesn't have permissions.

404.description: Environment not found.

500.description: Internal error raised.

get.summary: Returns all the DB connections of a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment.

200.description: The list of DB connections for an environment.

schema.description: The list of DB connections for an environment.

Success.description: Boolean indicating if the request was successful.

400.description: Failed to retrieve DB connections due to missing parameters.

404.description: Failed to retrieve DB connections due to invalid environment key.

500.description: Failed to retrieve DB connections due to internal error.

post.summary: Creates a new DB connection for an environment.

parameters.name: DbConnectionData
parameters.description: A structure holding the data for the DB connection.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment.

Success.description: Boolean indicating if the request was successful.

400.description: Failed to create DB connections due to missing parameters.

404.description: Failed to create DB connections due to invalid environment key.

500.description: Failed to create DB connections due to internal error.

get.summary: Returns the detail of a DB connection for a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment.

parameters.name: DbConnectionName
parameters.description: The name of the DB connection.

Success.description: Boolean indicating if the request was successful.

400.description: Failed to retrieve DB connection due to missing parameters.

404.description: Failed to retrieve DB connection due to invalid environment key.

500.description: Failed to retrieve DB connection due to internal error.

put.summary: Updates a DB connection for an environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment.

parameters.name: DbConnectionName
parameters.description: The name of the DB connection.

parameters.name: DbConnectionNewData
parameters.description: A structure holding the data for the DB connection.

Success.description: Boolean indicating if the request was successful.

400.description: Failed to update DB connection due to missing parameters.

404.description: Failed to update DB connection due to invalid environment key.

500.description: Failed to update DB connection due to internal error.

delete.summary: Deletes a DB connection for an environment.

parameters.name: DbConnectionName
parameters.description: The name of the DB connection.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment.

Success.description: Boolean indicating if the request was successful.

400.description: Failed to delete DB connection due to missing parameters.

404.description: Failed to delete DB connection due to invalid environment key.

500.description: Failed to delete DB connection due to internal error.

put.summary: Sets the DB connection permission levels for a Role in a given environment.

parameters.name: EnvironmentKey
parameters.description: The key of the environment.

parameters.name: DbConnectionName
parameters.description: The name of the DB connection.

parameters.name: RolePermissionLevel
parameters.description: The value of the permission level: Full Control, No Access, Read-Only

Success.description: Boolean indicating if the request was successful.

400.description: Failed to update the permission level due to missing parameters.

Application.description: An application with its details and its status in the environments were it is running.

Team.description: The team that owns the application.

URLPath.description: Relative URL path of the application, starting from the hostname.

IconHash.description: Hash of the application icon. Can be used to detect changes in the application icon.

IconURL.description: The URL for the application icon.

DetailsURL.description: The URL to access the application details in LifeTime.

IsSystem.description: Indicates if the application is a built-in component of the OutSystems platform (for example, Service Center or LifeTime).

AppStatusInEnvs.description: Information about the status of the application in each environment it is running.

ApplicationConfiguration.description: Represents the application configuration in a specific environment.

environmentKey.description: The key identifier of the environment which the configuration belongs to.

isBlocked.description: When set to 'True' the application cannot be deployed to the environment, otherwise it can.

isBlockedChangeReason.description: The provided reason why the attribute 'isBlocked' has been changed. Returns empty when the attribute was never modified.

ApplicationCreate.description: The application information used for its creation.

TemplateKey.description: Key of the template used to bootstrap the application. The template needs to be published in the environment where the application is being created. The list of possible values is obtainable by making a request to GET /environments/{EnvironmentKey}/templates/.

TeamKey.description: Key of the team to which the application belongs.

Name.description: The name of the application. Must be unique.

Description.description: A brief description of the application and its purpose.

Color.description: The primary color of the application used for the theme. Must be in hexadecimal format.

ApplicationOperation.description: Operation executed in the deployment over the application.

DeploymentOperation.description: Label of the operation to be performed. Example: Deploy 1.5.

ApplicationOperation_v2.description: Operation executed in the deployment over the application.

DeploymentOperation.description: Label of the operation to be performed. Example: Deploy 1.5.

ApplicationVersion_v2.description: Information about a specific version of an application and the versions of its modules.

ChangeLog.description: Change Log associated to this Application Version.

CreatedOn.description: When was the Application Version created.

InUse.description: Defines if the Application Version is being used.

PrimaryColor.description: The primary color of the application interface.

NativeHash.description: The native has relative to the mobile platform.

ApplicationVersionCreate.description: A structure holding the new version name for the application and for its native applications, if applicable.

ChangeLog.description: Change log of the version to be created.

ModuleVersionKeys.description: [DEPRECATED] List of module version keys to validate if the current state of the application is still the expected. This parameter was deprecated on LifeTime Feb 2019 Release, there is no need to pass the module version keys. If the module version keys are passed, they will still be validated.

AppStatusInEnv_v2.description: Status of application in a given environment.

BaseApplicationVersionKey.description: Base application version unique identifier. If app is not modified in environment, this is the application version deployed.

BaseApplicationVersionLabel.description: Base application version label. If app is not modified in environment, this is the application version deployed.

IsModified.description: True if the application has been changed since the last tag, false otherwise.

ConsistencyStatusMessages.description: Messages regarding the consistency status of the application.

MobileAppsStatus.description: Status of mobile apps in environment.

Deployment_v2.description: Deployment information with the operations executed.

DetailsURL.description: The URL to access the deployment plan in LifeTime.

CreatedOn.description: Date and time when the deployment plan was created.

CreatedBy.description: Name of the user who created the deployment plan.

CreatedByUsername.description: Username of the user who created the deployment plan.

SavedOn.description: The date and time when the deployment plan was saved.

SavedBy.description: Name of the user who last saved the deployment plan.

SavedByUsername.description: Username of the user who last saved the deployment plan.

StartedOn.description: The date and time when the deployment started.

StartedBy.description: Name of the user who started the deployment.

StartedByUsername.description: Username of the user who started the deployment.

AbortedOn.description: The date and time when the deployment was aborted.

AbortedBy.description: Name of the user who aborted the deployment.

AbortedByUsername.description: Username of the user who aborted the deployment.

ApplicationOperations.description: List of Application Operations included in the deployment.

DeploymentData_v2.description: Deployment information with the operations executed.

CreatedOn.description: Date and time when the deployment plan was created.

CreatedBy.description: Name of the user who created the deployment plan.

CreatedByUsername.description: Username of the user who created the deployment plan.

SavedOn.description: The date and time when the deployment plan was saved.

SavedBy.description: Name of the user who last saved the deployment plan.

SavedByUsername.description: Username of the user who last saved the deployment plan.

StartedOn.description: The date and time when the deployment started.

StartedBy.description: Name of the user who started the deployment.

StartedByUsername.description: Username of the user who started the deployment.

AbortedOn.description: The date and time when the deployment was aborted.

AbortedBy.description: Name of the user who aborted the deployment.

AbortedByUsername.description: Username of the user who aborted the deployment.

ApplicationOperations.description: List of Application Operations included in the deployment.

DeploymentMessage.description: Message from a deployment operation log.

Instant.description: Date and time when the message was logged.

DeploymentStatus.description:
Type of deployment status:
  • aborted:
    • The staging was aborted. In UI representation, the staging is displayed as “Aborted”.
  • aborting:
    • The staging is in the process of being aborted. In UI representation, the staging is displayed as “Aborting”.
  • finished_successful:
    • The staging finished successfully. In UI representation, the staging is displayed as “Finished successfully”.
  • finished_with_errors:
    • The staging finished but encountered errors. In UI representation, the staging is displayed as “Finished with errors”.
  • finished_with_warnings:
    • The staging finished but encountered warnings. In UI representation, the staging is displayed as “Finished with warnings”.
  • force_finished:
    • The staging was forcefully finished. In UI representation, the staging is displayed as “Force finished”.
  • needs_user_intervention:
    • The staging requires user intervention to proceed. In UI representation, the staging is displayed as “Waiting configuration or confirmation”.
  • running:
    • The staging is currently running. In UI representation, the staging is displayed as “Running” or “Started”.
  • saved:
    • The staging has been saved but not yet started. In UI representation, the staging is displayed as “Saved”.
The following UI statuses do not have a direct mapping from the API statuses but are part of the deployment plan:
  • Validated:
    • The staging has been validated and is ready for the next steps.
  • Review:
    • The staging is in review plan mode.
  • Prepared:
    • The staging is prepared and ready to run.

Info.description:
When DeploymentStatus is needs_user_intervention, the following values can be returned:
  • business_process_impact:
    • Is requested to check the warning messages before continuing the deployment.
  • deployment_prepared:
    • Indicates that new application versions are ready for deployment when the two-step deployment is configured.
  • needs_configuration_or_confirmation:
    • Is waiting for application settings in the plan or confirmation to continue.
  • deployment_suspended:
    • Deployment has been suspended. An error occurred in a step while deploying to the target environment.

DeploymentTechnology_v2.description: Deployment Hosting technology of the Deployment Zone.

IsDefault.description: True if the deployment zone is the default one in the environment

DownloadLink.description: The link for the application binary file.

url.description: The link for the application binary file.

expires.description: The expiration date and time of the returned link.

CanCreateApplications.description: True, if the role allows to create applications

CanAddDependenciesToSystem.description: True, if the role allows to add dependencies to system

Order.description: The order of the environment as registered in LifeTime.

DetailsURL.description: The URL to access the environment details in LifeTime.

HostName.description: Hostname of the environment as registered.

UseHTTPS.description: Indicates if connections to the environment are made using HTTPS.

EnvironmentType.description: Indicates the type of the environment. [Development|Test|Production]

NumberOfFrontEnds.description: Number of front-end servers in the environment.

IsCloudEnvironment.description: Indicates if the environment is running on a cloud service.

EnvironmentRegistration.description: Environment information needed to registration process

EnvironmentName.description: Name that identifies the environment in LifeTime.

EnvironmentAddress.description: Address that LifeTime will use to connect with the environment

ServiceCenterUsername.description: Username of a Service Center user with administrator privileges

ServiceCenterPassword.description: Password of a Service Center user with administrator privileges

LifeTimeAddress.description: Address that the environment will use to communicate with LifeTime

EnvironmentPosition.description: The staging position order of the environment in LifeTime

OverridePreviousLifetime.description: If true, the environment registration will override the previous LifeTime of the environment (when the environment is already registered in another LifeTime)

environmentKey.description: Key of the environment that refers to the permission.

environmentName.description: Name of the environment that refers to the permission.

levelLabel.description: Short description of the permission level.

addDependenciesToSystem.description: Allows to add depedencies to System application.

StatusCode.description: Status code raised with the error.

IsMaintenanceModeEnabled.description: Indicates whether or not an environment is in maintenance mode.

Reason.description: The reason why the environment maintenance mode is being set to enabled or disabled.

MobileAppStatusInEnv.description: Status of mobile application in a given environment.

VersionNumber.description: The version number, like for example 1.5.4, of the native build. It is used to be able to map the version to the version in the Andoid or iOS store.

HasBinaryAvailable.description: True if the binary of the application is available for the current configuration.

IsConfigured.description: True if the application is configured.

IsConfigurationChanged.description: True if the configuration of the Mobile Application has changed in the environment.

IsModified.description: True if the Native Hash of the Mobile Application does not match the one in the AppVersionNativeBuild baseline.

MobileVersion.description: A mobile version and its information.

VersionNumber.description: The version number, like for example 1.5.4, of the native build. It is used to be able to map the version to the version in the Andoid or iOS store.

VersionDescription.description: The description of the mobile version.

Module.description: Module information and the status in the environments where the modules are running.

ModuleStatusInEnv.description: Status of the module in environments

ConflictType.description:
Type of conflict: 

-Producer Module Missing
-Producer Element Missing
-Producer Element Incompatible
-Consumer Module Outdated
-Newer Producer Module Available
-IncompatiblePlatformServer
-ConsumerModuleMoved
-ProducerModuleMoved
-NameColision

ModuleStatusInEnv.description: Status of module in a given environment.

ConsistencyStatusMessages.description: Messages regarding the consistency status of the module.

ModuleVersion_v2.description: A module version and its information.

CreatedOn.description: Date and time of the module version creation.

CreatedBy.description: Name of the user that created the version.

CreatedByUsername.description: Username of the user that created the version.

GeneralHash.description: Non-unique hash of the module version. Can be used to validate if two module versions have semantic differences.

DirectUpgradeFromHash.description: If this module version is the result of a direct upgrade of another version, then this field contains the key of that version

level.description: Value that identifies the permission level.

levelLabel.description: Short description of the permission level.

description.description: Full description of the permission level.

manageInfrastructure.description: In OutSystems Cloud, users with a role that has this attribute can manage IT users, roles, and teams. In self-managed infrastructures, it additionally includes permission to manage environments and their configurations.

manageTeams.description: Allows to manage teams and roles.

environmentPermissions.description: Definition of permission levels per environment.

Environment_CSP_Response.description: Structure to hold environment CSP settings

DBConnection_Request_POST.description: Body of the request to create a new DB connection.

dbConnectionName.description: The name of the DB connection.

providerKey.description: The key of the provider for the DB connection.

description.description: The description of the DB connection.

dbUsername.description: The username for the DB connection.

dbPassword.description: The password for the DB connection.

dbConfigParams.description: DB connection configuration parameters. Configuration parameters must be separated by a semi-colon ';'.

DBConnection_Response.description: Body of the responde of the Get, List and Create methods for a DB Connection.

dbConnectionName.description: The name of the DB connection.

description.description: The description of the DB connection.

providerName.description: The name of the provider for the DB connection.

isAdvancedConfiguration.description: Boolean to define if it is an advance configuration for the DB connection. True when DB configuration parameters are set in the request.

databaseConfiguration.description: The DB configuration values whens etting an advanced configuration.

DBConnection_RolePermissionLevel.description: Structure that holds the data to manipulate the permission level for DB connections for a role.

permissionLevel.description: Identifier of the permission level. Permission levels: Full Control, No Access, Read-Only

DBConnection_UserPermissionLevel.description: Structure that holds the data to manipulate the permission level for DB connections for a user.

permissionLevel.description: Identifier of the permission level. Permission levels: Full Control, No Access, Read-Only

DbConnectionPermissionLevel.description: Structure that holds the data to manipulate the permission level for DB connections

Label.description: The label of the environment permission level.

ShortLabel.description: A shorter label of the permission level.

Description.description: The full description of the permission level.

Level.description: An integer representing the permission level.

DBConnectionRole.description: Structure that describes a Role for a DBConnection

DBConnectionUser.description: Structure that describes a User for a DBConnection

DbProvider.description: Structure that describes a DB Provider

ApplicationVersionKey.description: The key of the newly created application version.

User.description: Definition of a user. Also includes the teams to which the user belongs and the roles in specific applications.

UserRoleShortInfo.description: Pair User Key and Role Key minimal information.

ApplicationRole.description: Represents a set of an application and a role.

Solution_Request_POST.description: A structure holding the solution name, the application keys and a boolean to include or not application references.

DownloadSolutionLink.description: A structure holding the download url and the expiration date.

ExpiresAt.description: The expiration date and time of the returned link.

SolutionStatus.description: A structure holding the solution status and its reason.

REST_LogicalDatabase.description: Combination of extension and logical database to be mapped.

LogicalDatabase.description: Name of the database connection that needs to be mapped.

ExtensionDBMapping.description: The mapping of the logical database of an extension and a database connection in the destination environment.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the database connection as it stands in the destination environment.

LogicalDatabaseName.description: The name of the logical database in the extension.

ExtensionDBFullMapping.description: The mapping for all the logical databases of an extension to database connections.

DurationRecord.description: How long we want to renew the token.

timePeriod.description: Duration of the new token, in the specified units.

unit.description: Unit in which time period is set. Available units: M = Months

expiresAt.description: Date and time which the token expires
